revised_title: Spectro-Photometric Comparison of Emissivity of Solid, Liquid Copper, and Liquid Silver at High Temperatures
tldr: The authors conducted a spectro-photometric comparison of the emissivity of solid, liquid copper, and liquid silver at high temperatures. They used a "black body" apparatus to measure the radiation emitted by the metals and found that the emissivity of copper and silver differs significantly from that of a full radiator. The emissivity of solid and liquid copper was measured and compared, revealing a discontinuity at the melting point.
